articles.author: Julia Harte, Daniel Trotta, Brad Brooks
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's address to Congress received high marks from a group of voters who backed the president in November's election, saying in interviews they supported his promises to cut taxes, reshape the government and crack down on immigration.
articles.title: Combative Trump declares 'America is back'. Here's what his voters made of it

articles.author: Thomas Escritt, Angelo Amante, David Latona
articles.description: Some on Europe's far right are torn about Trump's dressing-down of Zelenskiy and his seeming indifference to the perceived threat Putin poses.
articles.title: Trump-Zelenskiy clash exposes divisions in Europe's rising far right

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has paused all military aid to Ukraine following his clash with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy last week, a White House official said on Monday.
articles.title: Trump halts all U.S. military aid to Ukraine, White House official says

articles.author: Bo Erickson, Steve Holland, Joseph Ax
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's speech to Congress on Tuesday was interrupted within minutes by catcalls from Democratic lawmakers, with one Texas congressman, Al Green, ordered removed from the chamber after he refused to sit down.
articles.title: Democrats disrupt Trump’s Congress speech as Texas lawmaker ejected

articles.author: Nellie Peyton
articles.description: Lesotho's foreign minister said on Wednesday he was shocked and insulted by U.S. President Donald Trump saying nobody has heard of the African country, and invited him to come visit.
articles.title: Lesotho insulted after Trump says nobody has heard of the country

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States has indicted 10 alleged Chinese hackers over a years-long cyber espionage campaign centered around a company known as Anxun, or i-Soon, Information Technology.
articles.title: US indicts 10 alleged Chinese hackers over years-long cyber espionage campaign

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States imposed sanctions on Wednesday on seven senior members of Yemen's Iran-aligned Houthi movement, the Treasury Department said.
articles.title: US issues new Houthi-related sanctions, Treasury Dept says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran refutes what it called 'accusations' made by Britain that it was trying to threaten the security of the UK, Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baghaei said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Iran refutes 'accusations' that Tehran is trying to threaten British security

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mozambican police fired on supporters of opposition leader Venancio Mondlane in the capital Maputo on Wednesday, injuring one of his entourage during a protest march, Portuguese news agency Lusa reported.
articles.title: Mozambique police fire on march by opposition supporters, Lusa reports

articles.author: Ali Sawafta, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Just metres from the last houses in Bardala, a Palestinian village at the northern end of the occupied West Bank, Israel's army has been bulldozing a dirt road and ditch between the community and open grazing land on the hills behind it.
articles.title: Israel's settler pressure on West Bank villages stirs annexation fears
